Container.Name: endlessh
Container.Overview: Endlessh(https://github.com/skeeto/endlessh) is an SSH tarpit that very slowly sends an endless, random SSH banner. It keeps SSH clients locked up for hours or even days at a time. The purpose is to put your real SSH server on another port and then let the script kiddies get stuck in this tarpit instead of bothering a real server.
Container.Changes:
### 2022-09-23 - Migrate to s6v3.
### 2022-07-20 - Rebase to Alpine 3.16.
### 2022-04-16 - Rebase to Alpine 3.15.
### 2021-10-07 - Fix typo on MAXLINES var.
### 2021-06-08 - Add BINDFAMILY option.
### 2021-04-16 - Initial Release.

Config.Name: MSDELAY
Config.Description: The endless banner is sent one line at a time. This is the delay in milliseconds between individual lines.

Config.Name: MAXLINES
Config.Description: The length of each line is randomized. This controls the maximum length of each line. Shorter lines may keep clients on for longer if they give up after a certain number of bytes.

Config.Name: MAXCLIENTS
Config.Description: Maximum number of connections to accept at a time. Connections beyond this are not immediately rejected, but will wait in the queue.

Config.Name: LOGFILE
Config.Description: By default, the app logs to container log. If this is set to `true`, the log will be output to file under `/config/logs/endlessh` (`/config` needs to be mapped).

Config.Name: BINDFAMILY
Config.Description: By default, the app binds to IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. Set it to `4` or `6` to bind to IPv4 only or IPv6 only, respectively. Leave blank to bind to both.
